description.value: An extension that mimics the default FHIR `MedicationAdministration.category`, `MedicationDispense.category` and `MedicationStatement.category` elements that can be used if multiple categories need to be captured. The mp-profiles fix a zib definition code to each `.category` thereby denying the use for other purposes because of their 0..1 cardinality.

purpose.value: This extension represents the `.category` element of the FHIR R4 MedicationAdministration, MedicationDispense and MedicationStatement resources. This extension is needed because `.category` has a cardinality of 0..1 in each of these resource types and the mp-profiles use `.category` with a fixed code, thereby denying the use of `.category` for other purposes. A future version of FHIR will relax the cardinality to 0...* and the binding strength to _example_. In addition to using this extension, a binding should be added to `extension.valueCodeableConcept` to the ValueSet of its respective resource type category and with a binding strength that matches the FHIR core binding strength., along with an appropriate definition and short.
